information_page.title: What is AAC?
information_page.lead: AAC (Augmentative and Alternative Communication) helps people understand and express themselves when speech alone is hard, unreliable, or unavailable.
information_page.what_is_p1: AAC is a toolbox of communication methods that either support speech (augmentative) or replace speech when needed (alternative).
information_page.what_is_p2: The goal is participation: being able to make choices, ask questions, share feelings, learn, and connect with others in everyday life.
information_page.who_intro: AAC can support children, teens, adults, and older people in many situations, for example:

who_items.motor: Motor disabilities that affect speech clarity or control
who_items.language: Language or communication delays and complex communication needs
who_items.temporary: Temporary communication barriers after illness, surgery, or fatigue

information_page.how_intro: A successful AAC setup usually combines four parts:

how_parts.symbols_body: photos, pictograms, words, letters, or gestures
how_parts.tools_body: paper boards/books or digital devices with communication apps
how_parts.access_body: touch, eye gaze, switches, scanning, or pointing aids
how_parts.partners_body: people who model and respond consistently at home, school, and in the community

getting_started_items.assess: Start with strengths, needs, and daily contexts — not just a device list.
getting_started_items.words: Choose useful vocabulary first (requests, feelings, people, routines).
getting_started_items.model: Model AAC while speaking naturally — show how to use it during real activities.
getting_started_items.consistency: Use AAC across the whole day with family, educators, and therapists.
getting_started_items.review: Review often and adapt symbols, access, and goals as needs change.

information_page.myths_m1_body: Evidence and practice show AAC can support language growth and often helps spoken communication too.
information_page.myths_m2_body: AAC is for any age when communication support is needed.
